snippet: Every month, thousands flee extrajudicial executions, disappearances, forced labor and sexual violence in the East African nation, a report found.
abstract: United Nations investigation reports reign of Eritrean Pres Isaias Afwerki is responsible for systematic, extreme and widespread human rights abuses which is causing hundreds of thousands of Eritreans to flee, exacerbating Mediterranean migrant crisis.

byline.contributor: Dan Bilefsky contributed reporting from London.

lead_paragraph: Every month, thousands flee extrajudicial executions, disappearances, forced labor and sexual violence in the East African nation, a report found.

headline.main: Torture and Other Rights Abuses Are Widespread in Eritrea, U.N. Panel Says
headline.print_headline: World Briefing | Africa; Eritrea: U.N. Details Extreme Abuses

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations

keywords.value: War Crimes, Genocide and Crimes Against Humanity
